result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:03 PM Defendant David R. Strait in court.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for David R. Strait.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Meyer-O'Day notes DE has another case and due to excessive time - collateral attack motion to be filed mid-November.  Requests this track w/the 2019 case.  State doesn't object.  Court questions status.  Atty Meyer-O'Day believes they can do a Waiver of PH.  Bond continued.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on December 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David R. Strait appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Blake Duren appeared by video for David R. Strait. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE has not yet applied for PD representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  Atty Duren advises DE was in custody yesterday and has been since May.  Court quashes warrant.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Duren requests a signature bond.  $1,500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.
